page.title: 10Land Ownership in Middleton
page.content: The Middleton Estate was first bought by the Waterhouse Family in 1913 from the Batemans. It consisted of most of the village, the Hall, farms and 1600 acres, (later increased to 1800 acres). The Estate - except the Hall, the amenity land and various cottages - was then sold by Capt. Charles Waterhouse in 1950. The farms were bought by another landlord but some tenants had been given the opportunity to buy their own farms prior to the sale. Today the land is part owner occupied, part tenanted by Bingham, Gregory, Brocklehurst, Dale, Mycock, Chatsworth Estate and Davy-Thornhill. In the village the houses are mainly owner occupied or belong to the Council or the Estate. At times there have been as many as five holiday homes.
